newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Oct 28.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Oct 28.

text.p: * McDonnell Douglas Corp has foregone plans to build its largest and longest-range airliner, the Wall Street Journal said. The stock closed at 53-1/8 on Friday.
* Anheuser-Busch Cos Inc was down 3/8 at 38-1/8 in London after an article in Barron's this weekend highlighted the intense competition and overcapacity in the beer market.
* Revlon Inc is expected to report third quarter earnings per share of $0.35, compared to $0.07 a year ago, according to First Call. Shares closed at 33-3/8.
* International Flavors & Fragrances Inc is expected to report third quarter earnings per share of $0.54, compared to $0.57 a year ago, according to First Call. The stock closed at 41-3/4.
* Perrigo Co is expected to report fiscal first quarter earnings per share of $0.16, flat with a year ago, according to First Call. The stock closed at 8-3/4.
* Cadence Design Systems Inc said it would merge with Cooper & Chyan Technologies Inc. Cadence closed at 38 and Cooper & Chyan closed at 31-1/2.

* Atlas Air Inc reported third quarter earnings per share of $0.37, compared to $0.32 a year ago. The First Call estimate was $0.49. The current third quarter includes aircraft charges of $0.12 per share after tax. The stock closed at 29-1/4.
* American Express Co is expected to report third quarter earnings per share of $0.95, compared to $0.83 a year ago, according to First Call. The stock closed at 46-3/4.
* Atlantic Richfield Co is expected to report third quarter earnings per share of $2.60, compared to $1.93 a year ago, according to First Call. The stock closed at 132-3/8.
